articles.title: “They Shall Not Grow Old” brings archive footage to stirring life
articles.description: The film applies modern production techniques to old film to achieve something poppies and pageantry cannot: immediacy
articles.content: FOR THE FALLEN, written by Laurence Binyon in honour of the British Expeditionary Force and published in September 1914, contains one of the best-known stanzas in poetry: They shall not grow old, as we that are left grow old: Get our daily newsletter Upgrade … [+4323 chars]

articles.title: How airports use biometric technology
articles.description: Airlines want to speed up the boarding process with facial-recognition software
articles.content: AS CHRISTMAS draws closer, airports around Western countries will be gearing up for their busiest days of the year. Many passengers will fear a repeat of the long queues seen at Heathrow Airport in August, when some holidaymakers waited over two-and-a-half ho… [+3249 chars]

articles.title: Destiny’s child: A scientist makes the case for the power of DNA
articles.description: In “Blueprint” Robert Plomin argues that genes are by far parents’ biggest influence on their children
articles.content: Blueprint: How DNA Makes Us Who We Are. By Robert Plomin. The MIT Press; 280 pages; $27.95. Allen Lane; £20. B Get our daily newsletter Upgrade your inbox and get our Daily Dispatch and Editor's Picks. H UBRIS WINDS through the history of genetics like a doub… [+5360 chars]

articles.title: Amazon’s “second headquarters” may be no such thing

articles.title: How to bring peace to Libya
articles.description: The UN’s plan offers the best hope of ending Libya’s chaos, but Italy and France are making things worse
articles.content: IT IS BY FAR the preferred jumping-off point for migrants hoping to reach Europe. Jihadists use its ungoverned spaces to train and plot attacks at home and abroad. In short, Libyas chaos is destabilising countries all around it. Yet European countries that he… [+4090 chars]
